wikipedia_page.main: William John Pendergast (13 April 1915 – May 2001) was a Welsh professional footballer who played as a forward in the Football League for Bristol Rovers, Chester and New Brighton. He was also on the books at Manchester United and Wolverhampton Wanderers, but failed to break into the first-team. He also spent time at Crewe Alexandra and Wrexham as an amateur.

response: Making his Colchester debut in a 1–0 win at home to Dartford in the Southern League Mid-Week Section, and scored his first goal in the league just two days later, as his side fell to a 2–1 defeat to Bristol Rovers Reserves. He almost missed the game, arriving at the ground 15 minutes before kick-off after manager Davis had appealed to railway officials at Paddington station to allow a non-stop train to Newport, Wales, to stop at Badminton, Gloucestershire, before a taxi took Wallis and fellow player Bill Pendergast to Bristol.
